1:
"My heart pounds when I think about that.
\q1
2:
Listen, all of you, to the thunder,
\q2 which is like God's voice.
\q1
3:
He sends thunder all across the sky,
\q2 and he sends lighting to the most distant places on the earth.
\q1
4:
After the lightning flashes, we hear the thunder,
\q2 which is like God's powerful voice;
\q2 when he speaks, he does not keep back the lightning.
\q1
6:
He commands the snow to fall on the ground,
\q2 and often he makes it rain very hard.
\q1
7:
When God does that, it prevents people from working,
\q2 in order that all people may know that he is the one who does these things.
\q1
8:
When it rains, the animals go into their hiding places,
\q2 and they stay there until the rain stops.
\q1
9:
The storms come from the place in the south where they start,
\q2 and the cold winds come from the north.
\q1
10:
In the winter water freezes when he commands it,
\q2 and the lakes become ice.
\q1
11:
God fills the clouds with moisture,
\q2 and lightning flashes everywhere from the clouds.
\q1
12:
He guides the clouds and causes them to move back and forth
\q2 in order that they may accomplish all that he commands them to do all over the world.
\q1
13:
Sometimes God sends rain to punish us, sometimes to water the land that he has made,
\q2 and sometimes because he wants to be very kind to us.
\b
\q1
15:
Do you know how God commands the lightning to flash down from his clouds?
\q1
18:
Can you stretch out the skies like God does and make them as hard as a metal mirror?
\b
\q1
20:
Should I ask someone to tell God that I want to speak to him?
\q2 No, because if I did that, he might destroy me.
\q1
21:
You know that people cannot look directly at the sun
\q2 when it shines brightly in the sky after the wind has blown the clouds away;
\q2 likewise we certainly cannot look at the brightness of God.
\q1
23:
Almighty God has very great power,
\q2 and we do not know how to go near to him.
\q1 He always acts righteously,
\q2 and he will never mistreat us.
\q1
24:
That is the reason that we have an awesome respect for him;
\q2 he does not pay attention to those who proudly, but wrongly, think that they are wise."
